title: behavior  about 18446744073709552000f64 is very different in `const`, `let`, `cargo run`, `rustc`
body:
This code

```rust
use std::u64;

fn main() {
    const A: f64 = 18446744073709552000.0;
    println!("{}", A as u64);

    let b: f64 = 18446744073709552000.0;
    println!("{}", b as u64);

    println!("{}", 18446744073709552000.0f64 as u64);
}
```

if save it in `1.rs` and `rustc 1.rs && ./1`, the output is 
```
18446744073709551615
140733973389600
18446744073709551615
```

if `cargo new rust-demo` and write the code in `main.rs` then `cargo run`, the output is 
```
18446744073709551615
0
18446744073709551615
```

my rustc is 
```
$ rustc --version  -v                     
rustc 1.39.0-nightly (4295eea90 2019-08-30)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 4295eea903a9e1014ee30f82930f5ec08d888077
commit-date: 2019-08-30
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.39.0-nightly
LLVM version: 9.0
```
my cargo is 
```
$ cargo --version --verbose
cargo 1.39.0-nightly (22f7dd049 2019-08-27)
release: 1.39.0
commit-hash: 22f7dd0495cd72ce2082d318d5a9b4dccb9c5b8c
commit-date: 2019-08-27

 
$ cargo rustc -- --version --verbose
   Compiling rust-demo v0.1.0 (/tmp/tmp.F7RPrp4cdz/rust-demo)
rustc 1.39.0-nightly (4295eea90 2019-08-30)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 4295eea903a9e1014ee30f82930f5ec08d888077
commit-date: 2019-08-30
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.39.0-nightly
LLVM version: 9.0
    Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.05s
```
